whyClientsChoose.name: Why Clients Choose Korn Ferry
whyClientsChoose.description: Key themes explaining why clients choose Korn Ferry and what differentiates them from competitors.

themes.label: Trusted Relationships and Expertise
themes.description: Clients value long-standing relationships with Korn Ferry consultants, built on trust and deep industry expertise.

supportingQuotes.text: I trust him with my business...Anywhere Chris went, I would go.
I knew the boss, I knew the consultant that I wanted to work with, because I have a deep trust in [Danny]'s... human touch.

themes.label: High-Quality Candidate Delivery
themes.description: Korn Ferry consistently delivers strong candidate pools that meet client expectations in terms of quality and fit.

supportingQuotes.text: They were very successful in finding the right candidate to meet our needs.
The candidate quality repeatedly exceeded expectations.

themes.label: Responsive and Proactive Communication
themes.description: Clients appreciate Korn Ferry's structured communication, regular updates, and responsiveness to feedback.

supportingQuotes.text: Greg scheduled by monthly calls with the team... to give us updates, to share... additional context on the candidates.
We had one scheduled weekly call throughout the process... and they were always available for other queries, more ad hoc stuff.

themes.label: Flexibility and Adaptability
themes.description: Korn Ferry demonstrates flexibility in engagement terms and adapts to changing client needs and market conditions.

supportingQuotes.text: Korn Ferry has been very good about working with us on those...It's that fine balance... and Korn Ferry has been very good about providing the flexibility that we need.
The resilience of the business and the people that I was working with to keep going is greatly appreciated.

themes.label: Deep Industry and Market Knowledge
themes.description: Clients choose Korn Ferry for their deep understanding of specific industries and markets, which informs effective search strategies.

supportingQuotes.text: They knew our business, they knew the nuts and bolts of our business, and they also understood the culture that we had.
She understands the healthcare business extremely well and she's really buttoned up on this.

promoterExperience.name: The Promoter Experience
promoterExperience.description: This theme category captures the key elements that promoters value most about their experience with Korn Ferry, focusing on what creates exceptional experiences and strong satisfaction.

themes.label: Strong Relationship Management
themes.description: Promoters value the deep, trusted relationships with Korn Ferry consultants, which are built on personal rapport, trust, and consistent engagement.

supportingQuotes.text: I trust him with my business...Anywhere Chris went, I would go.
I wanted the important advice, particularly of an individual who I happen to trust... somebody that understands the NHS.

themes.label: High-Quality Candidate Delivery
themes.description: Promoters appreciate the quality and alignment of candidates provided by Korn Ferry, which consistently meet or exceed expectations.

supportingQuotes.text: They were very successful in finding the right candidate to meet our needs.
The candidate quality repeatedly exceeded expectations.

themes.label: Responsive and Proactive Communication
themes.description: Promoters highlight Korn Ferry's consistent, proactive communication and structured updates as key to maintaining confidence and alignment.

supportingQuotes.text: Communication is always absolutely stand out...we are in regular communication.
Greg scheduled bi-monthly calls with the team... to give us updates.

themes.label: Flexibility and Adaptability
themes.description: Promoters value Korn Ferry's ability to adapt to changing needs and provide flexible solutions that align with client requirements.

supportingQuotes.text: Korn Ferry has been very good about providing the flexibility that we need.
They were very reactive and adapted it for the next reports.

themes.label: Deep Market and Subject Matter Expertise
themes.description: Promoters appreciate Korn Ferry's deep understanding of their business, industry, and specific role requirements, which enhances the search process.

supportingQuotes.text: They knew our business, they knew the nuts and bolts of our business.
She actually has an investment risk background. She understood the role, the needs.

whereFallsShort.name: Where the Experience Falls Short
whereFallsShort.description: This category identifies areas where Korn Ferry's service delivery and client experience could be improved, based on feedback from detractors and passives.

themes.label: Diversity and Inclusion Challenges
themes.description: Clients expressed concerns about the lack of gender diversity in candidate slates and the all-male composition of consulting teams.

supportingQuotes.text: We had to remind the guys a number of times that we want to see women as well as men.
All the consultants from Korn Ferry were all men... it didn't really sit very well.

themes.label: Compensation and Negotiation Issues
themes.description: Clients faced difficulties obtaining accurate compensation information and felt unsupported during negotiation processes.

supportingQuotes.text: Trying to get out of them what current comp was, was impossible.
I would have expected a little bit more of support... I would have appreciated a little bit more of challenging behaviour versus the candidate.
They shut her down immediately.

themes.label: Communication and Coordination Gaps
themes.description: Clients reported issues with late delivery of materials, inconsistent communication, and lack of assertiveness in leading discussions.

supportingQuotes.text: The reports would often land an hour or two before the call... you have no hope in hell of getting to it.
Early on, it was a little confusing... several different people... reaching out... we couldn't search for [emails] easily.
It just wasn't assertive enough.
It was a little bit challenging to build rapport with the lead person that I was dealing with.

themes.label: Candidate Sourcing and Quality Concerns
themes.description: Clients were dissatisfied with the breadth and originality of candidate sourcing, expecting more diverse and high-caliber candidates.

supportingQuotes.text: They didn't really generate the level of the candidates that we thought they should have.
There weren't really people who weren't on our radar that made you think, wow, that's amazing.
There was a bit of a feeling of lagging.

themes.label: Process and System Weaknesses
themes.description: Clients experienced operational inefficiencies, such as scheduling errors and reliance on client resources for logistics.

supportingQuotes.text: They rely on us very heavily for everything logistical...It feels like they kind of expect us to do their logistics.
Scheduling, coordination, and quality-control processes require greater consistency and internal oversight.
